abstract.text: Makes a CFNetService available on the network.

inlineContent.text: Use nw_browser_t or nw_listener_t in Network framework instead

if an asynchronous service registration was started;
if an asynchronous or synchronous registration failed or if a synchronous registration was canceled.
If the service is to run in asynchronous mode, you must call
to associate a callback function with this CFNetService before calling this function.
When registering a service that runs in asynchronous mode, this function returns

if the service contains all of the required attributes and the registration process can start. If the registration process completes successfully, the service is available on the network until you shut down the service by calling
, and
. If the service does not contain all of the required attributes or if the registration process does not complete successfully, this function returns
When registering a service that runs in synchronous mode, this function blocks until an error occurs, in which case this function returns
. Until this function returns
, the service is available on the network. To force this function to return
, thereby shutting down the service, call
from another thread.
The
parameter is a bit flag for specifying service registration options. Currently,

is the only supported registration option. If this bit is set and a service of the same name is running, the registration will fail. If this bit is not set and a service of the same name is running, the service that is being registered will be renamed automatically by appending
n
to the service name, where
n
is a number that is incremented until the service can be registered with a unique name.
This function is thread safe.

abstract.text: Access network services and handle changes in network configurations. Build on abstractions of network protocols to simplify tasks such as working with BSD sockets, administering HTTP and FTP servers, and managing Bonjour services.
An opaque reference representing a CFNetService.
An opaque reference representing a CFNetServiceBrowser.
Creates an instance of a Network Service browser object.
Flags that the system passes to net service browser callbacks.
Gets the Core Foundation type identifier for the Network Service browser object.
Invalidates an instance of a Network Service browser object.
Schedules a CFNetServiceBrowser on a run loop.
Searches for domains.
Searches a domain for services of a specified type.
Stops a search for domains or services.
Cancels a service registration or a service resolution.
A structure provided when a CFNetService is associated with a callback function or when a CFNetServiceBrowser is created.
An opaque reference for a service monitor.
Record type specifier used to tell a service monitor the type of record changes to watch for.
Options to use when registering a service on the network.
Makes a CFNetService available on the network.
Associates a callback function with a CFNetService or disassociates a callback function from a CFNetService.
Unschedules a CFNetService from a run loop.
Error codes that may be returned by CFNetServices functions or passed to CFNetServices callback functions.
The structure returned by  and .
The structure returned by  and .
A bitfield used for passing special allocation and other requests into Core Foundation functions.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
